events.text: Hey, [tootroot], I’m feeling a little better now.
Herb’s one of a kind, right? I’m very lucky to have you both.
[i]smile
What will I do with you if I’m fired…
We just started to get to know each other…
[color=#ffed29](What am I even getting fired for???)

[color=#ffed29](For visiting the Jones brothers?)
[color=#ffed29](Does that make sense???)
[color=#ffed29](What could I have done???)
[color=#ffed29](I gotta call Gramma.)

[color=#ffed29](This call is going to be a mess, I can feel it…)
[color=#ffed29](Sorry, Gramma, your son’s a mess.)
Hello?
Gramma, it’s Orven.
My dear Orven, lovely to hear from you.
I call every day!
Doesn’t make it any less lovely!
How are you feeling? I know things were a bit rough last night.
Would you believe worse?

NO!
Oh no, what happened today!?
Well, I got super sick, Gramma, like, I had to go home sick.

My baby!!! Let me get you some soup.
I’ll come to Ventreville and nurse you back to health!

I’m okay, Gramma, I’m okay.
Herb nursed me back to health!
Gave me a bunch of ginger and now I’m drinking and not vomiting!!!

Bless Herwin’s soul.
I’ll be sure to bring something for him and his mother when I come to visit.

But you sure I don’t need to come to Ventreville now?
Do you have ginger candies? I got ginger candies.

Haha, thanks, Gramma, I’m really okay. I think I’m full of ginger.
It’s just weird, you know? I didn’t have any contact with anyone that was sick…

Is that so…
What were your symptoms?

Nausea, vomiting, weakness, and dizziness.
Classic stomach bug stuff.
Any fever?

Hmm…no, I don’t think so?
No cough or chills, either.
Hmm…
You have any ideas on where this came from, Gramma?

I might.
Orven, baby, make sure you take care of yourself, alright?
If you need to take another sick day [i]just[/i] to rest, I want you to do so.
Well I can’t rest too much, I have [tootroot] now.
You have WHO???
[tootroot], my tootroot?
[color=#ffed29](I must’ve forgotten to tell her because of how crazy work has been.)
Uhh, yeah, so I have a tootroot.
Orven! Since when???
Just a couple days, Gramma, work has just been so crazy that I forgot to tell you!
Oh, child, you and your love for tootroots…
I told you about her a couple nights ago, when we first started calling at night!
I remember talking about Mister Avidine, but I don’t remember anything about a tootroot…
You must’ve been asleep for that part.
Oh dear, and what a good sleep I did have.
That’s my fault then, I apologize.
So you have a tootroot named [tootroot].
[color=#ffed29](I must’ve forgotten to tell her because of how crazy work has been.)
Uhh, yeah, so I have a tootroot.
Orven! Since when???
Just a couple days, Gramma, work has just been so crazy that I forgot to tell you!
Oh, child, you and your love for tootroots…
I talked to you about that yesterday Gramma, when we called in the morning?

Oh. I remember!
[tootroot], right.
You should eat the crop sprouting from it! Tootroot crops are very good for you.
I would, but she doesn’t even have seedlings…
Oh, did she just start flowering?
No, her flowers have been in full bloom for the last couple days.
Hmm, that’s odd. She might need to go outside more to sprout.
Like I should take her on walks?

I don’t know—you’re the tootroot expert!
I just think she should’ve at least sprouted seedlings by now.
Well, I’m not even sure if I’ll be able to keep her.
What?
Herb said I might be fired tomorrow.

WHAT?!
What are they [i]thinking[/i], firing my hard working son?!

I genuinely have [i]no[/i] idea.
Not to be cocky, but I KNOW that [i]my[/i] supervisor, Miss Odiche, [i]likes me as an employee.
Even if they’re thinking about how I talked with the [i]contracted[/i] apothecaries, I didn’t do anything wrong, Gramma, I promise you.
I believe you!

And I believe that you’ve convinced me to come on over right now!
To smack some sense into your bosses and to nurse my angel back to health.
Gramma, it’s a long way, and I swear I’m okay.
I might have to come back home soon, anyways…
Oh no, you don’t! Those that do my baby harm don’t have long left to live!
I do miss your chicken stock, though. That was my favorite part of being sick…
It’s all in the bones, baby.

That reminds me: your sickness.
If you don’t think you got sick from someone else, I think it’s because you’re torn.

Ever since you were young, whenever you were truly troubled, you got all sorts of sick.
Vomiting, dizziness, weakness, all of that checks out.
Troubled…

You’re my son, so you got a good and honest gut.
So, if you’re not listening to it, then it’ll tell you when it wants you to listen.
But how am I supposed to listen all the time?!
Sometimes my gut tells me to do something that people won’t like, or undermines people, or directly goes against people’s wishes!
I can’t…I can’t listen every time.

But, I know it doesn’t feel like I’m doing what’s right…
But isn’t doing nothing, NOT WRONG???
NO…No, I know that something being “not wrong” doesn’t mean that it’s right…
[i]ARGHHH!!!
I wanted to do what was right…but I just didn’t want to risk getting fired.

events.question: Baby…So, if you went back, what would you do?

events.choice: I would follow what people tell me to do.

events.text:
No, I wouldn’t risk it…look what it got me into.
I was cocky, and I should’ve just kept my head down.
No one else is making waves, why should I? The adults knew best from the start.

Well, I’m glad you listened to your gut.
And I hope you don’t hate it too much, your good heart and conscience are some of my favorite parts about you.
No matter what happens, Orven, baby, I’m here for you. And I’m proud of you.

events.choice: I would listen to my gut to do what’s right.

events.text:
I…I would listen to my gut.
It feels bad, Gramma…I know I could’ve said and done more.

But with what I DID do, I put myself at risk of getting fired!
So I don’t know what would’ve happened if I pushed more…

But, even still.
Orven, what matters is that you do what you think is right. No matter what happens.

You do that, the world could be against you, and I’d be the happiest Gramma alive.
Because my boy is the one person with sense and heart in him!
[i]Haha[/i], thanks, Gramma…sorry I didn’t commit all the way.

I am [i]proud[/i] of you, son.
The only thing you can do is reflect and choose to do right going forward.
And you’re doing that right now, even while you’re sick.

Well, it’s because I’m sick, right?
My gut is forcing me to do the right thing or I’ll puke for the rest of my life.
A good gut doesn’t let you stomach things that will poison you.
You’re right…you’re right, Gramma.

Thanks...I might call you earlier in the day depending on whether they fire me or not…
Just talking with you makes me feel better.
Likewise, I love you with everything I got.
I love you more than anything, Gramma.

Baby, try to sleep and rest.
Tomorrow, just easy foods, you hear? Bread and cereal.

Understood, Gramma, will do.
Talk to you soon.
[i]sigh…
[color=#ffed29](Herb is one of a kind. I’m lucky I have him as a friend…)
[color=#ffed29](I should make something for him when I get better.)
[color=#ffed29](Oh…well, if I’m fired, then I guess I’d need to like, drop it off at his house.)
[color=#ffed29](Wait. But if I’m fired, I don’t have a place to live in, right???)
[color=#ffed29](What am I even getting fired for???)

[color=#ffed29](For visiting the Jones brothers?)
[color=#ffed29](Does that make sense???)
[color=#ffed29](What could I have done???)
[color=#ffed29](I gotta call Gramma.)

[color=#ffed29](This call is going to be a mess, I can feel it…)
[color=#ffed29](Sorry, Gramma, your son’s a mess.)
Hello?
Gramma, it’s Orven.
My dear Orven, lovely to hear from you.
I call every day!
Doesn’t make it any less lovely!
How are you feeling? I know things were a bit rough last night.
Would you believe worse?

NO!
Oh no, what happened today!?
Well, I got super sick, Gramma, like, I had to go home sick.

My baby!!! Let me get you some soup.
I’ll come to Ventreville and nurse you back to health!

I’m okay, Gramma, I’m okay.
Herb nursed me back to health!
Gave me a bunch of ginger and now I’m drinking and not vomiting!!!

Bless Herwin’s soul.
I’ll be sure to bring something for him and his mother when I come to visit.

But you sure I don’t need to come to Ventreville now?
Do you have ginger candies? I got ginger candies.

Haha, thanks, Gramma, I’m really okay. I think I’m full of ginger.
It’s just weird, you know? I didn’t have any contact with anyone that was sick…

Is that so…
What were your symptoms?

Nausea, vomiting, weakness, and dizziness.
Classic stomach bug stuff.
Any fever?

Hmm…no, I don’t think so?
No cough or chills, either.
Hmm…
You have any ideas on where this came from, Gramma?

I might.
Orven, baby, make sure you take care of yourself, alright?
If you need to take another sick day [i]just[/i] to rest, I want you to do so.
Well, I think I might be resting for a while…
What are you saying?
Herb said I might be fired tomorrow.

WHAT?!
What are they [i]thinking[/i], firing my hard working son?!

I genuinely have [i]no[/i] idea.
Not to be cocky, but I KNOW that [i]my[/i] supervisor, Miss Odiche, [i]likes me as an employee.
Even if they’re thinking about how I talked with the [i]contracted[/i] apothecaries, I didn’t do anything wrong, Gramma, I promise you.
I believe you!

And I believe that you’ve convinced me to come on over right now!
To smack some sense into your bosses and to nurse my angel back to health.
Gramma, it’s a long way, and I swear I’m okay.
I might have to come back home soon, anyways…
Oh no, you don’t! Those that do my baby harm don’t have long left to live!
I do miss your chicken stock, though. That was my favorite part of being sick…
It’s all in the bones, baby.

That reminds me: your sickness.
If you don’t think you got sick from someone else, I think it’s because you’re torn.

Ever since you were young, whenever you were truly troubled, you got all sorts of sick.
Vomiting, dizziness, weakness, all of that checks out.
Troubled…

You’re my son, so you got a good and honest gut.
So, if you’re not listening to it, then it’ll tell you when it wants you to listen.
But how am I supposed to listen all the time?!
Sometimes my gut tells me to do something that people won’t like, or undermines people, or directly goes against people’s wishes!
I can’t…I can’t listen every time.

But, I know it doesn’t feel like I’m doing what’s right…
But isn’t doing nothing, NOT WRONG???
NO…No, I know that something being “not wrong” doesn’t mean that it’s right…
[i]ARGHHH!!!
I wanted to do what was right…but I just didn’t want to risk getting fired.

events.choice: I would follow what people tell me to do.

events.text:
No, I wouldn’t risk it…look what it got me into.
I was cocky, and I should’ve just kept my head down.
No one else is making waves, why should I? The adults knew best from the start.

Well, I’m glad you listened to your gut.
And I hope you don’t hate it too much, your good heart and conscience are some of my favorite parts about you.
No matter what happens, Orven, baby, I’m here for you. And I’m proud of you.

events.text:
I…I would listen to my gut.
It feels bad, Gramma…I know I could’ve said and done more.

But with what I DID do, I put myself at risk of getting fired!
So I don’t know what would’ve happened if I pushed more…

But, even still.
Orven, what matters is that you do what you think is right. No matter what happens.

You do that, the world could be against you, and I’d be the happiest Gramma alive.

I am [i]proud[/i] of you, son.

Well, it’s because I’m sick, right?
My gut is forcing me to do the right thing or I’ll puke for the rest of my life.
A good gut doesn’t let you stomach things that will poison you.
You’re right…you’re right, Gramma.

Thanks...I might call you earlier in the day depending on whether they fire me or not…
Just talking with you makes me feel better.
Likewise, I love you with everything I got.
I love you more than anything, Gramma.

Baby, try to sleep and rest.
Tomorrow, just easy foods, you hear? Bread and cereal.

Understood, Gramma, will do.
Talk to you soon.
[i]sigh…

??????
[color=#ffed29](Is it…)
[tootroot]!
[i]smile
Oh my gods! You have another head on yourself!
[i]smile
You look incredible!
I know, I wish I could say the same about myself…
But I’ll get you some more lettuce, and I’ll get a cool bath going too!
[i]smile
[tootroot]! Look at you!
Those peaches are CRAZY, they’re huge!
[i]smile
I see how you needed a whole tree to support those.
[i]smile
I’m glad you’ve been doing well.
I know, I wish I could say the same about myself…
But come in, come in! I’ll get you more peaches, and I’ll get a cool bath going too.
[i]smile
[tootroot]! You’ve got tomatoes on you!
[i]smile
Look at all of them, there are so many!
The pop of red really looks good on you.
I know, I don’t look good right now.
But you gotta come in! I’ll get you some more tomatoes, draw a cool bath, it’ll be great!
[i]smile
Did you like that bath? Nice and cool.
[i]smile
[i]smile
[i]smile
You know, I don’t have an appetite for most things right now.
But your lettuce looks so refreshing and crispy.
But your peaches look so ripe!
But your tomatoes look so bright.
I heard that apothecaries use Tootroot crops in medicines.
[color=#ffed29](Mr. Throck and Mr. Babinski would probably know.)
[i]smile
Could I possibly try a leaf of lettuce?
Could I possibly try one of your peaches?
You’d be lighter!
Oh, but I hope that doesn’t put you off balance.
Could I possibly try one of your tomatoes?
[i]smile
Really?
[i]smile
Okay, this shouldn’t hurt at all.
Wow, that was easy.
[tootroot], this is amazing!
[i]smile
[i]Haha[/i], you look so smug right now.
As you should, this is great.

And… wow!
The effects are immediate! I actually feel rejuvenated.
[i]smile
Wow, I can’t tell who did a better job at taking care of me, you or Herb.
Thank you, my friend.

It’s nice we can both take care of each other. 
I couldn’t have asked for a better pet.
[i]smile
[i]smile
[i]smile
…though I’m not sure if I’ll be able to do it for much longer.
Maybe you can take me to where you live and I’ll live with you, [i]haha.
[i]smile
[i]smile
[i]smile

But, somehow I think I’d be too big for your home, [i]haha.
Come here, girl.
Some pets before you go.
[i]smile
[i]smile
[i]smile
[i]sigh[/i], looks like it’s time…
I’ll see you around, okay? I know where you like to hang out now.
[i]smile
[i]smile
[i]smile
Love you, [tootroot].

??????
[color=#ffed29](Did Herb forget something?)
[tootroot]!
[i]smile
Look at you! You look amazing.
I know, I wish I could say the same about myself…
But I’ll get you some more lettuce, and I’ll get a cool bath going too!
[i]smile
[tootroot]! I’m so happy you’re here!
WITH A TREE!?
[i]smile
I’m glad you’ve been doing well.
I know, I wish I could say the same about myself…
But come in, come in! I’ll get you more peaches, and I’ll get a cool bath going too.
[i]smile
[tootroot], you’re just who I wanted to see.
[i]smile
Look at all these leaves! You’ve been working hard!
It’s paying off, you look great.
I know, I wish you could say the same about me…
But you gotta come in! I’ll get you some more tomatoes, draw a cool bath, it’ll be great!
[i]smile
I just got a little sick is all, don’t worry.
Gramma says this happens when I get stressed from deciding important things.
Aww, thanks for the cuddles, [tootroot].
[i]smile
[i]smile
[i]smile
You and Herb have really made me feel a lot better.
[i]smile
Part of me still wishes you’d live here with me, I feel like I’m less anxious when I have someone with me.
But I guess it’s better you didn’t get too cozy here, who knows what’s going to happen to me…
Aww, don’t worry, I’ll be okay.
Things will work out.
If I get to stay in Ventreville, I’ll find you for sure.
I promise.
[i]smile
[i]smile
[i]smile
I gotta see you fully sprouted, after all.

[i]sigh[/i]
Looks like it’s time for you to go.
[i]smile
Love you, [tootroot].
